Bush admits that Iraq is a mess, he says that America is not happy with the situation in Iraq, and therefore he is not happy with the situation in Iraq. He also accepts responsibility for the situation and admits to mistakes. I have never heard Bush sound like this before. The Democratic win in Congress must have been a real wake-up call. Now we just have to see if he really means anything he says and if anything will actually change in Iraq.

Bush admits that Iraq is a mess, he says that America is not happy with the situation in Iraq, and therefore he is not happy with the situation in Iraq. He also accepts responsibility for the situation and admits to mistakes. I have never heard Bush sound like this before. The Democratic win in Congress must have been a real wake-up call. Now we just have to see if he really means anything he says and if anything will actually change in Iraq.

 
 He intends to ship an extra 21500 troops to Iraq in the hope that will turn the operation around, and allow the Americans to restore a more or less intact country to the control of the Iraqi 'authorities'. Whether that's an 'actual change' or not depends on your definition of the situation.
 
 James.

The key change in the plan is that US Forces will remain in the areas they sweep. Previously, patrols would pass through a sector, clean out the bad guys, then leave whereupon the bad guys would return. 
 
 Where before, we were content to go into the kitchen, turn the lights on, squash the roaches, then pad off to bed, now we will remain in the kitchen with the swatter poised and the light on. Problem is, it costs money to burn that light. 
 
 The upside of all of this is that my brigade's rotation will speed up and we will likely return sooner than anticipated. That being said, I'm still curious why my 19 year old buddy from Oklahoma can go through 8 weeks of basic training, 13 weeks of andvanced training and then deploy to Baghdad while a 19 year old Baghdad resident who has had three years to train is not up to snuff. Yeah, I know -intuitively I understand that the US Soldier has the benefit of an established military training program. Still, you'd think that the Baghdaddy would at least be familiar with the territory...It is just troubling....Sadly, I agreed with much of what Durbin said and I despise the man. I just can't argue with him right now. When Democrats start making sense "now gods stand up for bastards" - Othello.

**
 
 If your newly elected Democrats allow Bush and his fellow crypto-fascists to get away with this escalation of their evil work, then your nation is without hope, and you may as well chuck your 'democracy' in the nearest garbage bin.

 Could you attempt to form a coherent thought, or is it beyond your capacity?

 Cordially,

 Swamp the place with troops. Enough of them will force a reasonable peace for a month or two so we can leave claiming a victory.
 
 That Iraq will lapse into chaos thereafter until another Saddam Hussein appears is irrelevant
